intro: Cheiranthus arvensis, commonly known as the field pansy, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features bright yellow or violet flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruit is a dry, capsule that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
